0.3.x API

ePub(url, [options])

Creates an epub.js Book object.

The ePub() function is a top-level/global function exported by the epub module.

Constructs a new Book object for the epub book at the given url.

const book = ePub('https://epub.server.example.com/path/to/book.epub');

It creates the book as:

  new Book(url, options);

Methods

The ePub function object has additional properties:

  • Book
  • Rendition
  • Contents
  • CFI - epubcfi
  • utils

These access the corresponding objects of the epub.js library.

Book

The Book object encapsulates an epub book. It has methods for opening, closing, rendering and navigating within the book.

Constructor: new Book(url, [options])

Constructs a new epubjs Book object for the book at the given url.

const book = new Book('https://epub.server.example.com/path/to/book.epub');

Arguments:

  • url (string) - The URL at which to request the epub book.
  • options (object) - Optional options object to configure the book.

Returns: an instance of Book.

The options argument can have the following fields:

  • requestMethod (function) - a function to use instead of the inbuilt request function for requesting resources. Default: utils/request
  • requestCredentials (boolean) - Send the xhr request with Credentials if truthy. Default: undefined
  • requestHeaders (object) - send the xhr request headers. Default: undefined
  • encoding (string) - optional to pass ‚Äòbinary‚Äô or ‚Äòbase64‚Äô to archived Epubs. Default: binary
  • replacements (string) - use ‚Äòbase64‚Äô, ‚ÄòblobUrl‚Äô or ‚Äònone‚Äô for replacing assets in archived Epubs. Default: ‚Äònone‚Äô
  • canonical (function) - function to determine canonical urls for a path. Default: undefined.
  • openAs (string) - optional string to determine the input type. Default: undefined.

Methods

open(input, what)

Open an epub from a URL or ArrayBuffer.

Returns: Promise that resolves when the book has been loaded.

Arguments:

  • input (string | ArrayBuffer) - a URL or path string or an ArrayBuffer.
  • what (string) - ‚Äòbinary‚Äô, ‚Äòbase64‚Äô, ‚Äòepub‚Äô, ‚Äòopf‚Äô, ‚Äòjson‚Äô or ‚Äòdirectory‚Äô
    • force opening as a certain type. Default: ???
load(path>

Load a resource from the Book.

Returns: a Promise that resolves to the requested resource.

Arguments:

  • path (string) - path to the resource to load.
resolve(path, [absolute])

Resolve a path to its absolute position in the Book.

Returns: (string) the resolved path string

Arguments:

  • path (string) - the path to resolve
  • absolute (boolean) - force resolving the full URL if true
canonical(path)

Get a canonical link to a path.

Returns: (string) the canonical path string

Arguments:

  • path (string) - ???
section(target)

Get a Section of the Book from the Spine.

Alias for: book.spine.get

Returns: (Section) the target Section of the Book

Arguments:

  • target (string) - the section identifier
renderTo(element, [options])

Render the book to a DOM element.

Returns: (Rendition) - the rendition object of the rendered book.

Arguments:

  • element (element | string) - The DOM element or string (???) to add the rendition to.
  • options (object) - The options for rendering the book.

The options argument can have the following fields:

  • ???
setRequestCredentials(credentials)

o

Set if request should use withCredentials.

Returns: ???

Arguments:

  • credentials (boolean) - true of request should use credentials???

How are the actual credentials set?

setRequestHeaders(headers)

Set headers that should be included with the request.

Returns: ???

Arguments:

  • headers (object) - the set of headers to include
coverUrl()

Get the URL of the cover image.

Returns: (string) the URL of the cover image

Arguments:

getRange(cfiRange)

Find a DOM Range for a given CFI Range.

Returns: (Range) - the DOM Range corresponding to the given CFI Range

key([identifier])

Generated the Book Key using the identifier in the manifest or other string provided.

Returns: (string) the generated key

Arguments:

  • identifier (string) - an identifier to be used insead of the identifier in the manifest. Default: the identifier in the manifest.
destroy()

Destroy the Book instance and all associated objects.

Returns: undefined

Arguments:

  • none

Rendition

The Rendition object encapsulates the rendering of an epub book. It has methods for attaching the rendition to a DOM element, getting and setting the location, etc.

Constructor: new Rendition(book, [options])

Constructs a new Rendition object for the rendition at the given Book.

const rendition = new Rendition(book, [options]);

Arguments:

  • book (Book) - The instance of Book to be rendered.
  • options (object) - Optional options object to configure the rendition.

Returns: an instance of Rendition.

The options argument can have the following fields:

  • width (number) - The width of the rendered book. Default: undefined
  • height (number) - The height of the rendered book. Default: undefined
  • ignoreClass (string) - class for the cfi parser to ignore. Default: undefined
  • manager (string|function|object) - The manager to manage the rendition. Default: ‚Äòdefault‚Äô
  • view (string|function) - ??? Default: ‚Äòiframe‚Äô
  • layout (string) - layout to force. Default: undefined.
  • spread (string) - force spread value. Default: undefined.
  • minSpreadWidth (number) - overridden by spread:none(never)/both(always). Default: undefined.
  • stylesheet (string) - url of stylesheet to be injected. Default: undefined.
  • resizeOnOrientationChange (boolean) - false to disable orientation events. Default: undefined.
  • script (string) - URL of script to be injected. Default: undefined.

Methods

attachTo(element)

Attach the rendition container to the given element in the DOM. The container must be attached before the rendering can begin.

Returns: Promise that resolves when the container has been attached.

Arguments:

  • element (element) - The DOM element to which the container should be attached.
clear()

Clear the rendered views.

Returns: ???

Arguments:

  • none
currentLocation()

Get the CurrentLocation object.

Returns: (displayedLocation|Promise) The displayedLocation object with the current location or a Promise that resolves to this.

Arguments:

  • none
destroy()

Remove and Clean Up the Rendition.

Returns: ???

Arguments:

  • none
direction(direction)

Adjust the direction of the rendition.

Returns: ???

Arguments:

  • direction (string) - the direction for the rendition.
display(target)

Display a point in the book.

The request will be added to the rendering Queue, so it will wait until the book is opened, rendering started and all previously queued rendering tasks have finished.

Returns: (Promise) a promise that resolves to ??? when the given target has been displayed in the rendition.

Arguments:

  • target (string) - URL or EpubCFI that determines the location in the book to be displayed.
flow(flow)

Adjust the flow of the rendition to paginated or scrolled (scrolled-continuous Vs scrolled-doc are handled by different view managers).

Returns: ???

Arguments

  • flow (string) - the flow to be set.
getContents()

Get the Contents object of each rendered view.

Returns: (Contents[]) Array of Contents objects, one for each rendered view.

Arguments:

  • none
getRange(cfi, ignoreClass)

Get a Range from a Visible CFI.

Returns: (range) a range object.

Arguments:

  • cfi (string) - An EpubCFI string defining the range.
  • ignoreClass (string) - a class to be ignored???
layout()

Adjust the laout of the rendition to reflowable or pre-paginated.

Returns: ???

Arguments:

  • settings (object) - ???
moveTo(offset)

Move the Rendition to a specific offset. Usually you would be better off calling display().

Returns: ???

Arguments:

  • offset (object) - ???
next()

Got to the next ‚Äúpage‚Äù in the rendition.

Returns: (Promise) A Promise that resolves when the rendition has been updated to display the next ‚Äúpage‚Äù.

Arguments:

  • none
prev()

Got to the previous ‚Äúpage‚Äù in the rendition.

Returns: (Promise) A Promise that resolves when the rendition has been updated to display the previous ‚Äúpage‚Äù.

Arguments:

  • none
reportLocation()

Report the current location.

Returns: ???

Arguments:

  • none
requireManager(manager)

Require the manager from the passed string, or as a class function.

Returns: ???

Arguments

  • manager (string|object) ???
resize([width], [height])

Trigger a resoze of the views.

Returns: ???

Arguments:

  • width (number) the width of the view.
  • height (number) the height of the view.
setManager(manager)

Set the manager function.

Returns: ???

Arguments:

  • manager (function) set the manager function to the given function.
spread(spread, min)

Adjust if the rendition uses spreads.

Returns: ???

Arguments:

  • spread (string) - ‚Äònone‚Äô or ‚Äòauto‚Äô.
  • min (int) - minimum width to use spreads at.
start()

Start the rendering.

Returns: (Promise) a Promise that resolves when rendering has started.

Arguments:

  • none
views()

Get the views member from the manager.

Returns: (Views)

Arguments:

  • none

Contents(url, [options])

Constructs a new epubjs Contents object.

const contents = new Contents();

Methods

EpubCFI(url, [options])

Constructs a new epubjs Book object for the book at the given url.

const book = new Book('https://epub.server.example.com/path/to/book.epub');

Methods

Utils(url, [options])

Constructs a new epubjs Book object for the book at the given url.

const book = new Book('https://epub.server.example.com/path/to/book.epub');
